articles.title: Mueller team to court: Ready for Papadopoulos sentencing - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN's Shimon Prokupecz reports that the Mueller team has asked for the courts to begin the sentencing process on George Papadopoulos, indicating his cooperation is no longer needed.

articles.title: Kushner's lawyer shares topics of questioning - CNN Video
articles.description: Jared Kushner's attorney Abbe Lowell tells CNN's Wolf Blitzer that Mueller's team questioned Kushner about potential Russian collusion, obstruction of justice, and his contact with foreign nationals.

articles.author: Sara Murray, CNN
articles.title: Roger Stone's finances examined by special counsel
articles.description: Special counsel Robert Mueller's team has been probing Roger Stone's finances as it summons a series of witnesses to gather more information about one of President Donald Trump's longtime advisers, according to people familiar with the situation.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/choe-sang-hun
articles.title: North Korea Says It Will Give Trump ‘Time and Opportunity’ to Reconsider
articles.description: With a carefully worded statement, North Korea tried to create an impression that Mr. Kim was the mature statesman trying to salvage the diplomatic process.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/maya-salam
articles.title: The Major Moments of Harvey Weinstein’s Undoing
articles.description: Mr. Weinstein is expected to be arrested in New York on Friday. Here’s a look at the producer’s downfall, and how it has been covered by The New York Times.

articles.author: Joshua Berlinger and Sophie Jeong, CNN
articles.title: North Korea says it's still willing to meet after Trump cancels summit
articles.description: North Korea says US President Donald Trump's decision to cancel next month's summit with leader Kim Jong Un runs counter to the global community's wishes for peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: The Muslims who fast for 22 hours a day
articles.description: The long days in Iceland mean that Muslims there have one of the longest Ramadan fasts in the world.

articles.author: Laura Stevens
articles.title: Amazon Alexa-Powered Device Recorded and Shared User’s Conversation Without Permission
articles.description: Amacon.com Inc. said that one of its Echo home speakers recorded a private conversation without permission and sent it to a person in the owners’ contact list, an incident that raises questions about the security of such voice-operated devices

articles.author: Gloria Borger and Evan Perez, CNN
articles.title: Trump's legal team discussed January interview with Mueller
articles.description: President Donald Trump's lawyers and special counsel Robert Mueller discussed a potential January 27, 2018, interview of the President before talks between the two sides stalled, sources briefed on the discussions told CNN.

articles.author: Kevin Liptak and Jeremy Diamond, CNN
articles.title: From grin to grim: Inside the Trump-Kim summit collapse
articles.description: The sun was setting, dinner was waiting and President Donald Trump was making the short walk to his private residence when, on March 8, he suddenly made a detour to the press briefing room.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/adam-satariano
articles.title: Europe, Enacting New Privacy Laws, Becomes World’s Foremost Tech Watchdog
articles.description: The European Union on Friday puts the world’s toughest data privacy rules into effect. The regulations are set to have an outsize impact far beyond Europe.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Amazon Alexa 'heard and sent private chat'
articles.description: The tech giant has offered a rather convoluted explanation as to what happened.

articles.author: Jeremy Herb, Manu Raju and Laura Jarrett, CNN
articles.title: White House lawyer attends start of Justice Dept. briefings
articles.description: White House lawyer Emmet Flood attended the start of two classified Justice Department briefings with lawmakers on a confidential intelligence source, adding to Democratic concerns that White House staff were taking part in the briefings on classified informa…

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Rush to buy Trump-Kim summit coin
articles.description: Interest in coins marking the scrapped meeting soars and the White House gift shop website crashes.

articles.title: Visual Story | U.S. and North Korean leaders have a sharp-tongued history
articles.description: Past rhetoric between U.S. presidents and North Korean leaders has been both optimistically diplomatic and sharply confrontational.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/david-e-sanger
articles.title: Trump’s Gamble Hits Reality Check in North Korea Negotiations
articles.description: The president had sought to deal with Kim Jong-un the same way he had handled real estate negotiations — with threats and flattery. It didn’t work.

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Trump’s Lawyers, Special Counsel Nearly Reached Deal for Interview at Camp David in January
articles.description: President Trump’s legal team is in an intense phase of negotiations over an interview with special counsel Robert Mueller—just as they were in January, when the two sides nearly agreed on specifics for a date that month at Camp David.

articles.author: Corinne Ramey
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein to Surrender in New York Sex-Crimes Case
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein, the veteran Hollywood producer, is expected to turn himself into authorities Friday in connection with a sex-crimes investigation conducted by the Manhattan district attorney’s office, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Weinstein 'to surrender to police'
articles.description: Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein expected to surrender to police on sexual misconduct charges, US media report

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/james-c-mckinley-jr, http://www.nytimes.com/by/william-k-rashbaum, https://www.nytimes.com/by/benjamin-mueller
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein, Accused of Sex Assault, Facing Arrest in New York
articles.description: Investigators in Manhattan were preparing to charge the disgraced movie producer as early as Friday.
